author: sky.cactus
content: I thought I fixed that...

author: sky.cactus
content:
```
base_fee_per_gas: int = 0 # default to 1,000,000,000 for blocks before INITIAL_FORK_BLOCK_NUMBER
```

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe that `=0` is confusing for people, despite the comment?

author: sky.cactus
content: Was just initializing it to default value to satisfy python.

author: sky.cactus
content: Can one of the 1559 authors please approve this PR?  It has been sitting open for a month and it is just a typo fix: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3210

author: sky.cactus
content: Also, I feel like EIP-1559 has a lot of authors and none of them are actually watching PRs against the EIP.  Almost every PR that has been opened against it sits for a *long* time and usually requires pestering authors to get eyes on it.  What can we do to get the current authors looking at PRs more regularly, and/or add new authors who will take on that task?

author: barnabemonnot
content: definitely agree with that. i am guessing the initial value needs to be hardcoded in advance (no way to be fancypants about it and have e.g., median gas fee over last 1000 blocks?), could use this dashboard as reference: https://duneanalytics.com/kroeger0x/gas-prices

author: sky.cactus
content:
> no way to be fancypants about it and have e.g., median gas fee over last 1000 blocks
Possible, but would increase complexity in clients which would have a negligible impact.

author: barnabemonnot
content: in any case it's probably safer to undershoot basefee than to overshoot? i am guessing there will be some epsilon time during which wallets might flip from legacy to 1559 format, and while in legacy they wouldn't have as much range as the max fee allows for

author: sky.cactus
content: Realistically, we probably will see almost 0 1559 transactions at fork block, they'll all still be legacy transactions.  So the base fee change won't even have a UX effect until sometime *after* the fork block anyway, so I don't see any particular need to rush to get the base fee on-target.

author: sky.cactus
content: How long does it take to go from 0 attoeth to 100 nanoeth at 2x full blocks?

author: barnabemonnot
content: from 0 wei to 100 Gwei? :p

author: barnabemonnot
content: if it's a 10^11 increase i find ~215 blocks

author: sky.cactus
content: So about an hour?

author: sky.cactus
content: I feel like 1 hour / 215 extra blocks is not something we should concern ourselves over.

author: sky.cactus
content: I updated the EIP with 1 nanoeth starting base fee because it was an unintentional change when I introduced some other changes to the EIP, but I think it is unnecessary.  I don't mind leaving it since that is what people have implemented, but I don't think we should try to tune it any further.

author: timbeiko
content: I'd like to have it at 100 gwei _also_ to make it hard to lower to 0 if needed. Worst case, it means the first few blocks aren't full, right?

author: timbeiko
content: yeah the EIP has a lot of "past" authors. Vitalik, Eric, Ian and Rick won't be looking at the PRs.

author: timbeiko
content: We added Abdel, not sure who else it would make sense to add? You seem like a reasonable candidate, <@!301186049323958275> ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: If you can and are willing to exercise a censorship attack it becomes trivial to get the fee to 0 no matter how far from 0 it is.

author: timbeiko
content: fair enough, yeah

author: sky.cactus
content: As indicated above, it takes 1 hour to go between 0 and 100 nanoeth (both directions), which is basically nothing.

author: timbeiko
content: fair enough! and, you know, it's a nice "tip" to miners to get 200 extra blocks with high tips

author: timbeiko
content: <@!486501030046203915> may be another good candidate.

author: sky.cactus
content: I can be an author if you all want, though I care more about ensuring we get reviews and PRs merged and I am one of the top submitters of PRs so we would still need *someone* besides me reviewing those at least.

author: timbeiko
content: Yeah, I think <@!574864862338088960> has been reviewing them, but aside from that it's pretty empty. Anyone else in here want to review Micah's PR ðŸ™‚ ?

author: barnabemonnot
content: happy to! not sure exactly what I am supposed to do?

author: barnabemonnot
content: hmm ok i think i did the thing I was supposed to do. it was a one-letter change to the eip right? reviewed this: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3210

author: sky.cactus
content: You did the right thing, except for you need to be an author of the EIP (GitHub handle on Author line) for the bot to care.  ðŸ™‚

author: barnabemonnot
content: Good bot!

author: mafaz4371
content: did you launch eip 1559 already? ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: No.  It will be several months *at the least* (probably significantly longer).

author: mafaz4371
content: but its decided already it will be implemented?

author: sky.cactus
content: It is being implemented by several teams, but not all.  Implementation doesn't mean deployment as well, there are EIPs in the past that have been implemented by not deployed.

author: poojaranjan
content:
Ethereum Cat Herders are inviting the community especially #miners to address concerns with the EIP-1559. If you've questions, join the call on Feb 26 at 1400 UTC. Details available in the announcement blog - 
https://medium.com/ethereum-cat-herders/ethereum-1559-community-call-d43d5f0bf909

If you can not join the live stream, you may also leave your questions on Reddit post and we will share it with the panelists - https://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/lg45h3/ethereum_1559_community_call/
